titleStmt.title: Dispatch from Joas L. Forres to L. de R. du Verge, November 1 1882

bibl.title: Dispatch from
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml file, encoded, transcribed.

div1.p: L de R. de Verge Esq.re United States Consul Loauda.

Without any you to ausure, I satisfy my fact of the 8th of October per S.S. Beuguella. "Samples of produce alone this district:" Enclosed please find a bell a bading for a bol of samples of the produce of Mossamedes, which will be beut by the first pocket, and in a few ays, the said samples consist of: orchilla Beans And corn Rum Wheat Almeidina

What regard to these samples, I must say that Almeidina from which 50 p.C. of good Indian Rubber is attached, what regards to wheat, this country has not produced anything to speak of as they have not lumed their attention to its cutiration, bu lately and it has had to consider all the extent, and they sanguinely expect a great result.
Produce exported from this District: as follow. Cides Wax Ivory Dried Fish Brine Orchilla Almeidina Cotton
Vegetables Fruit Oxen Cows Sheep Rum Garden produce, beans peas, j.j. Wheat source as stated above
American shipping. "The Am: Ship "Milton" Capt S.B. letter, entered this port on the 1st of October, sailed on the 19th of the same month; Whalins"

On the 12th of the same month ent.d American Back "Alice Knowles" Capt. Promas Foster, came in to repesh and returned Whalins on the 19th of the same. On the 10th of the same month and Am. Ship "Eliza Adams" Capt. Walter F. Hourland, also came in to repesh and returned Whalins on the 21st ditto.

From the back "Alice Knowles" the sailor Henry Williams was landed sick, and who will go on to your city by the first packet, hearing a certificate from this agency dated October 26 1882. The "Eliza Adams" shipped on the 25th H sailors 2 of which have array immediately after signing their articles and receiving 8 dollars and 50 court in advance; they were arrested 2 days after the sacking of the ship, and I sending them on to yaen consulate by first favorable opportunity that you may dispose of them as you may think fit; it is probable that I shall have to advance the money for their passages of which I will duly advise you. Their names are "Jared Miller" and "Charles Fins". Another sailor, his name of "Augustus Fernandes" ran away from the said ship, and came today to present himself to me; I shall send him also to you with
the other 2. and advise the amount of passagers and expenses which I have advanced them here. It seems to me proper to send them to Loauda that it may be known here after to others coming here in future, that such acts will not be comenainced without being punished according to Law.
Being all for the present, I remain with all due respect and consideration
"Signed" Joas L. Forres W.S. Consul agent
div1.fw: P.S. sailor ashore described as "Augustus Fernandes" is "Augustus Lasow".
